skill.name: algorithmic-art
skill.description: Creating algorithmic art using p5.js with seeded randomness and interactive parameter exploration. Use this when users request creating art using code, generative art, algorithmic art, flow fields, or particle systems. Create original algorithmic art rather than copying existing artists' work to avoid copyright violations.

skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with minimal audit applied. The template loads p5.js and fonts from CDNs, which requires network access.

content.value_statement: You need a repeatable way to build original generative art with clear controls. This skill provides a p5.js viewer template and guidance for seeded randomness and parameter exploration.
actual_capabilities: Provides an HTML viewer template with sidebar layout, canvas area, and control sections.
Includes seed input and previous, next, and random seed functions in JavaScript.
Defines parameter sliders and color pickers with update handlers.
Seeds p5.js randomness with randomSeed and noiseSeed for reproducible output.
Supplies a generator template with parameter objects and utility helpers.
limitations: Requires network access to load p5.js and Google Fonts from CDNs.
The viewer template includes placeholder algorithm code that you must complete.
Outputs are single HTML artifacts, not hosted deployments.
Large particle counts can reduce browser performance.

use_cases.title: Prototype a new system
use_cases.description: Draft a seeded sketch with sliders to explore behavior quickly.

use_cases.title: Teach generative principles
use_cases.description: Demonstrate how parameters and seeds change outcomes in a live viewer.

use_cases.title: Share visual directions
use_cases.description: Provide a single HTML file with controlled variations for review.

prompt_templates.title: First philosophy
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a simple starting point
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a short algorithmic philosophy and list three tunable parameters for a seeded p5.js sketch.

prompt_templates.title: Flow field study
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a philosophy for flow fields and suggest parameters for particle count, speed, noise scale, and trail length.

prompt_templates.title: Subtle reference
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a quiet concept seed
prompt_templates.prompt: Use a subtle theme of coastal fog and outline a seeded p5.js system with color controls and sliders.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced dynamics
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a high craft philosophy for two interacting fields and define parameters, seed controls, and reset behavior.

output_examples.input: Create a philosophy and plan for seeded flow fields with adjustable density.
output: Movement name and a two paragraph philosophy focused on emergent flow
Parameter list with density, speed, noise scale, and trail length ranges
Viewer plan with seed controls, sliders, and reset behavior

best_practices: Keep all parameters in one object so UI updates are simple.
Regenerate the system after seed or major parameter changes.
Use seeded randomness for reproducible variations.
anti_patterns: Copying a specific artist style or protected work.
Removing seed controls that enable reproducibility.
Setting particle counts so high that the browser freezes.

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Any modern browser that runs HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and p5.js.

faq.question: Are there output limits?
faq.answer: Outputs are templates and guidance, not hosted sites or pre rendered images.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into my app?
faq.answer: Yes. Embed the single HTML viewer and inline p5.js code.

faq.question: Does it send data externally?
faq.answer: The templates include no data collection or transmission.

faq.question: What if the sketch runs slowly?
faq.answer: Reduce particle counts, simplify math, or lower canvas size.

faq.question: How is it different from static art tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on procedural systems with reproducible variation, not manual editing.
